qas.question: Who controlled Macedon after Alexander died?
The Roman Empire became more controlling of Greece starting in what year?
Macedon lost what war in 168 BC?
In what year did Greece become a part of Rome?
The end of Antigonid rule began in what year?

context: After a period of confusion following Alexander's death, <a0_0>the Antigonid dynasty<a0_0/>, descended from one of Alexander's generals, established its control over Macedon and most of the Greek city-states by 276 BC. From about <a1_0>200 BC<a1_0/> the Roman Republic became increasingly involved in Greek affairs and engaged in a series of wars with Macedon. Macedon's defeat at the <a2_0>Battle of Pydna<a2_0/> in <a4_0>168 BC<a4_0/> signalled the end of Antigonid power in Greece. In <a3_0>146 BC<a3_0/> Macedonia was annexed as a province by Rome, and the rest of Greece became a Roman protectorate.
